# STATES
Please note: For all states, the placeholder text, field icon and additional description below the input field are optional.

----
## DEFAULT

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-01-3xfuorsim_.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### EMPTY
When a user has not interacted with the input field.

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-02-oatmuiec7n.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### PLACEHOLDER TEXT
When a field contains text to assist the user and the user has not interacted with the input field.

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-03-j2pj8t6vyd.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### FILLED
When a user has previously entered text into the input field, but is no longer interacting with it.

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-04-cno3p1q1kk.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### ERROR
When a user is not currently interacting with an input field and field validation returns an error.

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-05-to13zax3d5.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### WARNING
When a user is not currently interacting with an input field and field validation returns a warning. Note: Not all fields require a warning validation. 

[Back to Top](#)

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-06-i5bd2ljjfy.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### SUCCESS
When a user is not currently interacting with an input field and field validation returns as success.  Note: Not all fields require a success validation.

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-07-b66coxrohs.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### EMPTY
When a user has their mouse placed over the input field.

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-06-i5bd2ljjfy.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### SUCCESS
When a user is not currently interacting with an input field and field validation returns as success.  Note: Not all fields require a success validation.

![](https://knapsack.imgix.net/site/knapsack-nucleus/input-fields-09-ffnja3il-o.svg?h=200&w=540)
#### FILLED
When a user has their mouse placed over the input field containing user input.
